content: diagram Creating physical volumes from two minidisks To create physical volumes from new minidisks at virtual device addresses 0702 and 103, completing the following steps: 1. Check the devices on your system with the lsdasd command. 2. The pvcreate command initializes partitions for use by LVM. Initialize the two new DASD partitions: # pvcreate /dev/dasde1 /dev/dasdf1 Physical volume "/dev/dasde1" successfully created Physical volume "/dev/dasdf1" successfully created 3. Verify that the physical volumes were created with the pvdisplay command: # pvdisplay /dev/dasde1 /dev/dasdf1 "/dev/dasde1" is a new physical volume of "3.44 GiB" --- NEW Physical volume --- PV Name /dev/dasde1 VG Name PV Size 3.44 GiB Allocatable NO PE Size 0 Total PE 0 Free PE 0 Allocated PE 0 PV UUID s0ugfl-hlV3-fYnf-1adW-4mOI-4HTJ-HdA0TU "/dev/dasdf1" is a new physical volume of "3.44 GiB" --- NEW Physical volume --- PV Name /dev/dasdf1 Volume Group - homevg Physical Extent (PE) Physical Extent (PE) Physical
